properties.title: Cartographer
properties.description:
Cartographer

Northern Natural Gas
December 2006 to March 2008

• Used Linear Referencing tools to maintain geospatial data for over 16,000 miles of natural gas pipeline by using GPS data, aerial photography, and as-built CAD documentation.
• Created pipeline profiles using 3D Analyst and DEMs to facilitate construction projects.
• Utilized Data-Driven Pages to maintain High Consequence Area map sets for DOT submission and field team use, showing the potential impact radius of pipelines.
• Selected feasible and cost effective routes and conducted competitive threat analysis for potential pipelines and presented findings in clear and concise maps.
• Produced maps for emergency response teams as an on-call cartographer.

properties.title: Sustainable Agriculture Volunteer
properties.description:
Sustainable Agriculture Volunteer

United States Peace Corps
February 2004 to April 2006

• Promoted sustainable organic agriculture techniques by constructing and managing 12 community gardens and over 200 family gardens.
• Educated farmers on the inexpensive elaboration of organic fertilizers and insecticides thereby eliminating the need to purchase and use costly and dangerous agrochemicals.
• Assisted community members with basic business techniques to enable them to sell organic vegetables to hostels and tourists, thereby increasing family incomes.
• Instructed community groups and individuals on practical methods to improve their nutrition resulting in the significant decrease of family malnourishment.
